attr.principle: amplification of parasites in laboratory rodents

attr.indication: T. evansi infections in horses and camels

reference: Brun, R., Lun, Z. R. (1998). Trypanosoma evansi and T. equiperdum: distribution, biology, treatment and phylogenetic relationship (a review). Veterinary Parasitology, 79(2), 95-107. - Unknown

attr.method: intramuscular or subcutaneous injection at 3.5-7 mg/kg
attr.indication: T. vivax, T. congolense, and T. brucei infections

reference: Sellon, D. C. (2007). Miscellaneous Parasitic Diseases. In Equine Infectious Diseases (pp. 387-391). Saunders. - Unknown

attr.indication: T. evansi, T. equiperdum, and T. simiae in horses, camels, pigs, and dogs

attr.method: fluid therapy, blood transfusions, treatment of secondary infections

attr.method: insecticides, traps to reduce fly numbers
attr.target: biting flies, especially tabanids and Stomoxys
